TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SearchType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of search in an instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchExpression> filter option uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchType> enumeration when it performs a string comparison. You set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchExpression.SearchType%2A> property to one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchType> enumeration values.
## Examples The following example shows how to use markup to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchExpression> filter option to the StartsWith value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchType.StartsWith> enumeration.
``` <asp:SearchExpression SearchType="StartsWith" DataFields="Name" > ```

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchType Contains = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that a search should determine whether the search string matches a string anywhere in a field.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchType EndsWith = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates that a search should determine whether the search string matches a string at the end of a field.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.SearchType StartsWith = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that a search should determine whether the search string matches a string at the beginning of a field.
